It's not really a game: there are no winners or losers.
It's just so we can=
 experiment, try new methods, and see what works, and learn.
I enjoyed your=
 help in the last experiment, and I hope you will continue to contribute!

=

2010 at 2:28 PM, rasterer <rasterer@yahoo. 
          com> wrote:

        =
  
            =C2=A0 
            
            
            
            E=
xperiment 2

On Friday, 7/16/2010 I placed an object on 
            top of=
 my computer monitor, right in front of me, and will leave it 
            =
there until noon Denver time on Monday, 7/19/2010. This experiment 
       =
     asks for participants to determine what that object is. Vague or 
    =
        partial answers won't be counted (for example, just giving a color,=
 
            shape, size, what it's made of, etc): we're looking for what =
it is. 
            Answers anyone reveals after noon Monday won't count. P=
articipants 
            can use their ghost boxes, EVP recorders, or any o=
ther means they 
            chose. At the end of the experiment, I will re=
veal the object, and a 
            tally of the number of correct and/or i=
ncorrect answers.

In 
            order to keep me honest, I have taken a =
picture of the object at the 
            start of the experiment and loade=
d it to the Files section (RJ 
            folder) of this group. The idea =
with this file is that you can 
            download it now and 'keep it sa=
fe' on your computer. Then at the end 
            of the experiment, I wil=
l post the password so you can reveal the 
            contents of the file=
. That way, you were in control of the original 
            image during t=
he entire test, not me. If you can follow the link, it 
            is here=
:

Windows users: http://tech. groups.yahoo. com/group/ 
            EVP-IT=
C/files/ RJ/RJ20100716. win.zip

Mac users: http://tech. groups.yahoo. com/=
group/ 
            EVP-ITC/files/ RJ/RJ20100716. mac.zip

And if you do no=
t 
            care to download the zip file now, I will post the final ima=
ge there 
            at the end of the experiment anyway.

My monitor is o=
ne of the 
            older box-like SONY CRTs, and says "Trinitron" and "=
Multiscan 200sf" 
            on the upper front. I have a couple monitors =
stacked in my closet 
            too: they are not the monitors used in th=
is experiment (and have 
            nothing else on them anyway), and I ha=
ve several laptops around: 
            they are also not the monitors in t=
his experiment. The monitor in 
            this experiment is the only SON=
Y monitor I have, says "SONY in 
            various places on it, can be s=
een in the following link from the 
            first experiment, when the =
correct answer would have been 
            "radio":

http://tech. groups.y=
ahoo. com/group/ 
            EVP-ITC/files/ RJ/RJ.20100710. 1.JPG

Please =
post all 
            answers to the group thread: that way, there will be =
a public record 
            and I won't get accused of losing any answers.=
 

And best of 
            luck to all the participants!
